tuv.seg: The parliamentary public petitions system allows members of the public raise issues of general public interest or concern or issues of public policy with the Houses of the Oireachtas (parliament)

Ceadaíonn an córas achainíocha poiblí parlaiminteacha do mhuintir an phobail saincheisteanna atá ina ndíol spéise nó ina n-ábhar buartha don phobal i gcoitinne nó saincheisteanna beartais phoiblí a thabhairt chun solais le Tithe an Oireachtais (an pharlaimint)
The subject of a petition must relate to a matter on which the Houses of the Oireachtas have the power to act
Ní mór go mbaineann ábhar achainí le ceist a bhfuil an chumhacht ag Tithe an Oireachtais gníomhú ina leith
Only one signature is needed to submit a petition
Ní theastaíonn ach síniú amháin chun achainí a sheoladh ar aghaidh
A decision on a petition is made by the Joint Committee on Public Petitions
Déanann an Comhchoiste um Achainíocha Poiblí cinneadh ar achainí
If you are submitting a petition it must relate to a matter on which the Houses of the Oireachtas have the power to act and the petition must be in the proper form
Má tá achainí á seoladh ar aghaidh agat, ní mór go mbaineann sí le ceist a bhfuil an chumhacht ag Tithe an Oireachtais gníomhú ina leith
• Relate to a case where court proceedings have been initiated and the case is being or will be heard before a jury
• Nach mbaineann sí le cás inar cuireadh tús le himeachtaí cúirte agus ina bhfuiltear ag éisteacht leis an gcás os comhair giúiré
• Contain the name or names of individuals
• Nach gcuimsíonn sí ainm nó ainmneacha daoine aonair
• Contain language which is offensive or defamatory
• Nach gcuimsíonn sí friotal atá maslach nó atá clúmhillteach
• Be frivolous, vexatious or otherwise constitute an abuse of the petitions system
• Nach bhfuil sí suaibhreosach, cráiteach nó ní mór nach mbaineann sí mí-úsáid as an gcóras achainíocha
• Be the same as or substantially similar to a petition brought by you, or on behalf of you, during the current lifetime of the Dáil and which was closed by agreement of the Joint Committee
• Go bhfuil sí mar an gcéanna nó cosúil go mór le hachainí a rinne tú, nó a rinneadh thar do cheann, i rith shaolré reatha na Dála agus a dúnadh le comhaontú an Chomhchoiste
You should be able to demonstrate that you have already taken steps to resolve the issue, for example, through raising it with the Ombudsman or directly with the relevant government department

Ba cheart go mbeifeá in ann a léiriú gur ghlac tú céimeanna cheana féin chun an tsaincheist a réiteach, mar shampla, tríd an tsaincheist a thabhairt chun solais leis an Ombudsman nó go díreach leis an roinn ábhartha rialtais
The Joint Committee will not consider a complaint which has been the subject of a decision by an Ombudsman or some regulatory or redress body
Ní dhéanfaidh an Comhchoiste breithniú ar ghearán a bhí ina ábhar cinnidh ag an Ombudsman nó ag comhlacht rialála nó sásaimh éigin
Joint Committee on Public Petitions
An Comhchoiste um Achainíocha Poiblí
You submit your petition to the Joint Committee on Public Petitions which is a parliamentary committee consisting of TDs and Senators
Cuireann tú d’achainí faoi bhráid an Chomhchoiste um Achainíocha Poiblí, ar coiste parlaiminteach é ar a bhfuil Teachtaí Dála agus Seanadóirí
The Joint Committee must first decide whether your petition is compliant with Dáil and Seanad standing orders (pdf)
Ní mór don Chomhchoiste cinneadh a dhéanamh i dtosach báire ar cé acu an gcomhlíonann nó nach gcomhlíonann d’achainí orduithe seasta na Dála agus an tSeanaid (pdf)
If it is considered to be compliant, it will then consider your petition
Má mheastar go bhfuil sé comhlíontach, déanfaidh sé breithniú ar d’achainí
When considering your petition the Joint Committee may invite you to appear before it
Nuair a dhéantar breithniú ar d’achainí, féadfaidh an Comhchoiste cuireadh a thabhairt duit teacht os a chomhair
It may also seek oral or written evidence from the relevant government department, as well as other appropriate bodies or stakeholders
Anuas air sin, féadfaidh sé fianaise ó bhéal nó scríofa a lorg ón roinn ábhartha rialtais, chomh maith le comhlachtaí nó páirtithe leasmhara cuí eile
• Refer your petition to some other parliamentary committee for further consideration and a report
• D’achainí a atreorú chuig coiste parlaiminteach éigin eile go ndéanfar breithniú agus tuairisciú breise uirthi
• Refer your petition to an ombudsman or some regulatory or redress body
• D’achainí a atreorú chuig ombudsman nó comhlachta rialála nó sásaimh éigin
Following its considerations, the Joint Committee makes a decision on what further action it will take
Tar éis a mbreithniúcháin a dhéanamh, déanann an Comhchoiste cinneadh ar cén gníomh breise a ghlacfaidh sé
This action can include reporting to the Dáil with recommendations, including a request that the report be debated by the Dáil
Féadtar tuairisciú a áireamh leis an ngníomh seo leis an Dáil agus moltaí a dhéanamh, agus a iarraidh go ndéanann an Dáil díospóireacht ar an tuarascáil
If the Joint Committee decides that no further action is required your petition will be closed
Má dhéanann an Comhchoiste an cinneadh nach dteastaíonn breis gníomhaíochta, dúnfar d’achainí
You will be notified of the Joint Committee’s considerations and its final decision
Tabharfar fógra duit faoi bhreithniúcháin an Chomhchoiste agus an cinneadh deiridh a dhéanfaidh sé
There is no charge for submitting a petition
Ní ghearrtar aon mhuirear ar achainí a sheoladh ar aghaidh
You are encouraged to submit your petition online
Spreagtar thú chun d’achainí a sheoladh ar aghaidh ar líne
You can also download the petition form (pdf) and submit it:
Chomh maith leis sin, féadfaidh tú foirm na hachainí a íoslódáil (pdf) agus í a sheoladh ar aghaidh:
• By e-mail to submitapetition@oireachtas.ie
• Ar ríomhphost go dtí submitapetition@oireachtas.ie
• By post to the Clerk to the Joint Committee on Public Petitions at the address below
• Sa phost chuig an gCléireach leis an gComhchoiste ar Achainíocha Poiblí ag an seoladh thíos
Further information and advice on the petitions process can be obtained from the Clerk to the Joint Committee on Public Petitions
Is féidir breise faisnéise agus comhairle ar an bpróiseas achainíocha a fháil ón gCléireach leis an gComhchoiste ar Achainíocha Poiblí
A list of petitions already submitted is available on the Houses of the Oireachtas website
Tá liosta d’achainíocha a seoladh ar aghaidh cheana féin ar fáil ar láithreán gréasáin Thithe an Oireachtais
Joint Committee on Public Petitions
An Comhchoiste um Achainíocha Poiblí
